articles.title: About this blog
articles.description: Just sharing some small projects and other stuff I've been doing.
articles.contents:
I love learning and using R and RStudio to wrangle, analyse, model, and visualise data. In fact, this website was created using the distill package in R. RStudio has all the tools I need to create RMarkdown files and push them through to GitHub. I am indebted to Yury Zablotski for this video on YouTube, explaining how to create a blog using the distill package and Assoc Prof Alison Hill for this blog post showing how to integrate postcards with distill. My main online resource for learning R is DataCamp, although recently I have been spending most of my “R time” watching the Statistics Globe channel on YouTube. I also do courses on Linkedin Learning and at the moment I am watching Python for Data Science Essential Training Part 1 by Lillian Pierson. I am a big fan of Brandon Foltz on YouTube who is great at explaining statistical concepts step-by-step.
The easiest way to contact me is probably via Twitter. My Twitter handle is @mikejhudson.
I hope you find these posts interesting. If you’d like to, you can buy me a coffee.
This page last updated: 2022-02-06

            Hello and welcome to my blog.
            I am a self-directed learner of R, Python, Tableau and SQL, living in the Shoalhaven Area of NSW. My interests include statistics, chess, linear algebra and machine learning.
            Bachelor of Business Studies at Charles Sturt University (Completed 2021)
            Bachelor of Data Analytics at University of South Australia (Commencing 2022)
